page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
The area covered is the northern tip of ISLIP and the whole of LOWICK. The area is predominantly farmland with a large expanse of water, the result of sand and gravel extraction. There are also wooded areas containing mainly deciduous trees.
The recent completion of a bypass linking the A 509 with the New Town of CORBY has removed virtually all through traffic from these two villages.
There are few amenities available within the area but it is well served by a number of nearby towns, where most of the population finds its employment.
